body: I believe that tags related to passive scans can be configured via [this](https://www.zaproxy.org/docs/desktop/ui/dialogs/options/pscan/) dialog. If your response is taking too long to be matched against html_mailto, maybe try disabling that tag and running the scan again?

Awesome, thanks!


On Fri, Apr 2, 2021 at 2:59 PM pranavsaxena17 ***@***.***>
wrote:

> I believe that tags related to passive scans can be configured via this
> <https://www.zaproxy.org/docs/desktop/ui/dialogs/options/pscan/> dialog.
> If your response is taking too long to be matched against html_mailto,
> maybe try disabling that tag and running the scan again?
>

Isaac DawsonSenior Security Engineer, Vulnerability Research | GitLab

rename.from: Passive Scan rule html_mailto performance issues
rename.to: Passive Scan tag html_mailto performance issues

body:
If you are not using the GUI they can also be disabled from the command line with `-config` arg:
https://www.zaproxy.org/faq/how-do-you-find-out-what-key-to-use-to-set-a-config-value-on-the-command-line/
This should resolve the issue for me, shall I close this report? Or do you want to keep it open to investigate the regex performance?
It's ok to leave open for now.

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/17878530/173497865-efd2c73a-698a-4167-a4e0-997b8fcbfcce.png)
in my case, it took over 1min to scan a large bundle file

and the total scan time dropped from over 6 hours to less then 1 hour after disabling it.

version `owasp/zap2docker-stable:2.11.1`

UPDATE:
we have just switched from weekly to stable a few days ago, before that the total scan took about 5-6 hours so i would say ithe time it took was similar.
the way how we did the scan was sending the traffic through the proxy during the automated testing.
the total number of pending pscan was around 50k when automated testing was finished.
the bundle js file size was around 4.5mb

so the issue was the scanner repeatedly scan the identical bundle file and it took over 1min each time.
Could you try the weekly release without disabling the tag? Just to check how much difference #7270 does in this case.

can confirm it's the issue of `resBodyRegex`.
changing it to `/\shref\s*=\s*['"]?mailto:/` instead of disabling it also fixed the issue.

BTW, about the weekly images, we experience some abnormal behavior in pscan and that's why we decided to switch to stable.
This was what happen when i was testing it.
1. I ran the automated testing through zaproxy and let the pscan queue built up to about 1000 pending scan.
2. I aborted the automated testing, then the number dropped from around 1000 to 4 in less than 5 second, where 4 related to "number of passive scan threads", because it increased to 10 after I changed "number of passive scan threads" to 10.
3. I checked "currentRules" api and found out it mostly scanning mailto, that's why I discover this issue. However it's still consistently updating so I assumed there were pending scans that were not counted correctly by "recordsToScan"
I tested it's normal until `w2022-05-23` and this happened on both `w2022-05-30`, `w2022-06-07`
Did you test both positive and negative cases?
@knilink Please open another issue,  that new block of three items is unrelated. It's likely related to: https://groups.google.com/g/zaproxy-users/c/ywuxxTOZldE/m/uojkxKZXCwAJ

@kingthorin yeah, just want to say the threading didn't help solving this performance issue since weekly image was asked about in the comment above. What we saw was  `recordsToScan` stuck at 4 for 5 hours long which was confusing.

Ii'll open another issue after i do a double check when I have time because threading had been released in `w2022-05-23` but `recordsToScan` seemed to be normal with that image.
Thank you. I didn't expect it to fix it, just wanted to see if it did any difference.

issue.title: Tweak the html_mailto regular expression

repository.name: zaproxy
repository.description: The ZAP by Checkmarx Core project

issue.body:
Do not require the start of a tag (`<`) when searching for mailto in
href attributes to reduce the time it takes when scanning.
Other regular expressions that search for attributes don't require it
either.

Fix #6509.

body: This issue has been automatically locked since there has not been any recent activity after it was closed. Please open a new issue for related bugs.
